page.title: 15LANGUAGE
page.content: "Alroight 'ow yer gooin."This is a traditional Brummie greeting.The Brummie accent is fairly common but the area contains accents,dialects and languages of all kinds.The town centre with its facilities for business and entertainment attracts people from all around the conurbation. The ear can pick out contrasting levels of speech.Tourists visit from all over the world adding to the linguistic and accental diversity. Surrounding residential areas such as Ladywood contain multiracial groups and many schools have special English Language classes to help non English speaking pupils.In Birmingham, the mixture of different languages in a relatively small area is very great. "Trra-a-bitt."(Traditional Brummie)
